an4.69:4.3: The endeavor to restrain, to give up, to develop, and to preserve.
an4.69:4.4: And what, mendicants, is the endeavor to restrain?
an4.69:4.5: It’s when you generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities don’t arise.
an4.69:4.6: This is called ‘the endeavor to restrain’.
an4.69:5.1: And what, mendicants, is the endeavor to give up?
an4.69:5.2: It’s when you generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that bad, unwholesome qualities are given up.
an4.69:5.3: This is called ‘the endeavor to give up’.
an4.69:6.1: And what, mendicants, is the endeavor to develop?
an4.69:6.2: It’s when you generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities arise.
an4.69:6.3: This is called ‘the endeavor to develop’.
an4.69:7.1: And what, mendicants, is the endeavor to preserve?
an4.69:7.2: It’s when you generate enthusiasm, try, make an effort, exert the mind, and endeavor so that wholesome qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.
an4.69:7.3: This is called ‘the endeavor to preserve’.
an4.69:8.4: taught by the Kinsman of the Sun.
an4.69:8.5: Any mendicant who keenly applies these
an4.69:8.6: may attain the ending of suffering.”
